metadata.titleEn: A giant bamboo rat from the latest Miocene of Yunnan
metadata.description: (1) This data includes original images and line diagrams of bamboo rat tooth fossils at the Shuitangba site in Zhaotong, Yunnan, as well as measurement data on tooth size. (2) The main channels for obtaining data are camera photography, microscopic measurements, and literature collection. (3) The image quality is a high-resolution original size image. (4) The prospect of image application is that it can be used for further in-depth research and comparison.
metadata.instructions: The data naming includes two parts: images and tables. The naming convention for images is consistent with the illustrations in the paper; The table naming method is consistent with the original data in the paper table. Can be directly referenced and analyzed.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the specific characteristics of image data collected from teeth fossils of giant bamboo rats in the Late Miocene of Yunnan?
Feature Specification.Answer: high-resolution, original size images, original pictures, line drawings, measurement data of teeth dimensions

Quantification.Question: How many high-resolution images were captured for the giant bamboo rat tooth fossils from the late Miocene in Yunnan?
Quantification.Answer: The metadata does not specify the exact number of high-resolution images captured for the giant bamboo rat tooth fossils.

Definition.Question: What are the primary methods used for collecting high-resolution image data of rodent fossils in paleontological research?
Definition.Answer: The primary methods for collecting high-resolution image data of rodent fossils include camera photography and microscopic measurement, as well as literature collection.

Comparison.Question: How do the data collection methods of capturing high-resolution images through camera photography and microscope measurements compare to literature-based data acquisition techniques in terms of accuracy and detail for giant bamboo rat tooth fossils?
Comparison.Answer: The data collection methods include camera photography and microscope measurements, which provide high-resolution original size images and precise measurements of tooth dimensions, compared to literature-based data acquisition that may rely on previously recorded data or secondary sources.

Goal Orientation.Question: What are the primary goals of capturing high-resolution images and measuring tooth dimensions for a dataset on fossilized giant bamboo rat teeth from the Late Miocene of Yunnan?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary goals of capturing high-resolution images and measuring tooth dimensions are to provide detailed visual and quantitative data that can be used for further in-depth comparative research. These images and measurements aim to enhance the understanding of the morphological characteristics and evolutionary history of giant bamboo rats from this period.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the key steps involved in capturing high-resolution images and measuring the dimensions of giant bamboo rat tooth fossils using a camera and microscope?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The key steps include using a camera to capture high-resolution original size images of the giant bamboo rat tooth fossils, conducting measurements of the teeth under a microscope, and collecting data from relevant literature to ensure comprehensive size measurement data.

Enablement.Question: What technological tools and methods enable the high-resolution imaging and measurement of fossilized rodent teeth for research purposes?
Enablement.Answer: The data collection methods include using cameras for high-resolution photography and microscopes for precise measurement of the teeth fossils.
